text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- The government is allowed to take foreign loans worth up to $3.2 billion in 1997.
- Romania and Moldova will build a gas pipeline connecting the cities of Chisinau and Iasi.
- The budget deficit is expected to amount to 4.5 percent of the GDP.
- Natural gas consumption is on decline following recent gas price hikes.
- Parliament endorsed bill allowing foreigners to own land in Romania.
- Romania's railway transport system is affected by lax security, Transport Minister Traian Basescu says in interview.
- Trade unions in the farming sector threatened to launch series of strikes to protest against what they called failure of the government to relaunch the sector.
